thread.title: 2nd Annual New York Metro Joint Cyber Security Conference 2015
thread.title_full: 2nd Annual New York Metro Joint Cyber Security Conference 2015 - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: 2nd Annual New York Metro Joint Cyber Security Conference 2015
text:
NYMJCSC
The entire security community of the NY/NJ/CT metropolitan area is joining forces to assemble what we expect will be a premier Cybersecurity Conference on October 14, 2015. The purpose of this educational conference is to heighten cybersecurity awareness in alignment with the National Cyber Security Awareness Month in October.
NEW YORK , Oct. 9, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- On October 14 , the New York Metro Joint Cyber Security Conference (NYMJCSC) will hold its 2nd annual cybersecurity conference at the Microsoft Technology Center, 11 Times Square in NYC. The NYMJCSC is a collaborative event cooperatively developed, organized and sponsored by the leading information security industry organizations and chapters: – ACFE, ISACA, ISSA, (ISC)², InfraGard, HTCIA, and OWASP.
Logo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151009/275669LOGO
Opening keynote address by Tim Rains , Microsoft's Chief Security Advisor for WW Cybersecurity & Data Protection, followed with a keynote by Ron Ross , Fellow at the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST). In addition to the 2 keynotes, the agenda offers 16 sessions over 4 topic tracks, as well as a CISO panel. Seating is limited .
As a non-profit conference, NYMJCSC 2015 aims to provide participating organizations' members and the public an educational opportunity with breakfast, lunch, and reception included! Over 20 hours of learning from the track sessions. We will have experts from the following disciplines and topics: Emerging News and Trends for Security, including Windows 10 security; Audit / Legal – Data Classification, Litigation and Legislation that affect your Cyber Risk posture, a panel discussion with CISOs; Application Security - Top Five Mobile Threats; and Risk Management – Detecting the malicious insider (and those masquerading as malicious insiders). Members of the public are invited to attend, but numbers are strictly limited. All registered conference attendees will have the opportunity to win a Microsoft Surface Pro 3!
For 2015, NYMJCSC is offering a pre-conference workshop on Tuesday, October 13th featuring four in-depth full-day hands-on classroom-style educational courses to expand your knowledge and foster security discussions. Seating is limited 30 per class, certain classes are hands-on and require BYOD.
About New York Metro Joint Cyber Security Conference: This is the first collaborative event cooperatively developed, organized, and sponsored by the following leading information security industry organizations and chapters: InfraGard ( New York Metro), ISACA ( New York Metro, New Jersey , and Greater Hartford CT ), ISC² ( New Jersey ), ISSA ( New York Metro) - OWASP ( New York Metro, Brooklyn and Long Island ), HTCIA (Northeast) and ACFE ( New Jersey ).
Contacts: New York Metro Joint Cyber-Security Conference
John C. Checco , C|CISO, CISSP, CSSLP, CCSK, Steering Committee Member, Conference Chair, info@NYMJCSC.org
Alex Abramov , CISA, CGEIT, CRISC, Steering Committee Member, Program Chair, program@nymjcsc.org
Joseph Rivela , Sponsorship Committee Co-chair, sponsorship@NYMJCSC.org
Yolanda Baker , CISA, Steering Committee Member, Sponsorship Committee Co-Chair, and Publicity Yolanda.Baker@NYMJCSC.org
